business.headline: What is Mutual Fund Lite? All you need to knowThe aim of the Mutual Fund Lite framework is to simplify the rules for managing passively managed mutual funds.

New life insurance rules from today: What it means for you? As of October 1, policyholders will now be eligible for a guaranteed surrender value from the first year, even if they have only paid one annual premium. However, these new regulations are expected to lower returns for policyholders over time.

Google pays $2.7 billion to bring back AI visionary Noam ShazeerNoam Shazeer, 48, was one of Google's early hires, joining the company in 2000. A talented software engineer, Shazeer made his mark in AI, becoming a key figure in Google's early AI development.

Ola Electric shares slip below Rs 100. Buy the dip or avoid? The stock was down 2.59% at Rs 99.55 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE), marking a sharp decline from its record high of Rs 157.53 on August 20, 2024.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Iran threatens 'vast destruction' as Netanyahu vows payback for missile attack Live UpdatesAs Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu vowed that Iran would pay for its missile attacks, Tehran warned that any retaliation by Israel or its allies will be met with "vast destruction".

US warns Iran of 'severe consequences' after it launches missiles into IsraelUS President Joe Biden said there was a discussion under way about how Israel would respond, and he planned to speak with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu.

Tim Walz cornered over claim he was in Hong Kong during 1989 protest: I misspokeUS election 2024: During the debate, the moderator questioned Tim Walz about reports that suggested he had falsely claimed to be in Hong Kong during the 1989 Tiananmen Square massacre.

Avoid unnecessary travel: India to its nationals in Israel amid Iran escalationAn advisory issued by the Indian Embassy in Tel Aviv asked Indian nationals to stay vigilant and adhere to the protocols as advised by the local authorities.

Ground Report: Children among thousands displaced at Syria-Lebanon borderWith Israel's ground invasion intensifying, families are pouring across the border, seeking refuge from the relentless airstrikes and artillery barrages.

Gambhir vs Dravid: Could India have pulled off Kanpur heist under former coach?Gautam Gambhir couldn't have asked for a better start to his stint as India's head coach in Test cricket. India pulled off a miracle in Kanpur, racing against time and decimating Bangladesh in a rain-curtailed match, flaunting all-out aggression. Would such a result have been possible during the tenure of former head coach Rahul Dravid?

Netanyahu says Iran made 'big mistake' by firing missiles, 'will pay for it'Israel-Iran conflict: As the rockets streaked through the sky, Israeli defence systems were quickly activated to intercept the incoming threat.

Rajinikanth in hospital: PM Modi enquires wife Latha about actor's healthSuperstar Rajinikanth underwent an elective procedure on October 1 at a private hospital in Chennai. Prime Minister Narendra Modi spoke to his wife, Latha, over a phone call to enquire about the actor's health.

Are item songs and adult music pushing kids to mature early? If you don't find children dancing to adult songs concerning, there is a problem. Exposing children to music that's not age-appropriate can negatively affect their mental health, self-esteem, and body image.

Mahayuti will win 2024 Maharashtra polls, BJP in 2029, says Amit ShahAddressing BJP workers in Mumbai, Amit Shah said that the party aims to secure over 50 per cent seats in Mumbai and Konkan regions in the upcoming elections.

Watch: Iran rains rockets on Israel in revenge for Hezbollah leader's killingIran fired a barrage of ballistic missiles and rockets at Israel in retaliation to the latter's military operation in Lebanon and assassination of top leadership of its proxy groups Hamas and Hezbollah.

In a statement, the Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps (IRGC) of Iran said, "In response to the martyrdom of Ismail Haniyeh, Sayyed Hassan Nasrallah, and Nilforooshan, we targeted the heart of the occupied territories."

JD Vance slams Biden on immigration, Tim Walz questions Trump's economic policies Live UpdatesDemocrat Tim Walz and Republican JD Vance clashed in their sole vice-presidential debate ahead of the November 5 election, discussing critical issues like the Middle East conflict, climate change, immigration, the economy, and abortion.

How rape convict Gurmeet Ram Rahim gets parole so easily? Panelists debateAhead of the Haryana elections, the Haryana government has granted a 20-day parole to Dera Sacha Sauda chief Gurmeet Ram Rahim Singh while barring him from taking part in election-related activities.

Historic immigration crisis: JD Vance vows to build US-Mexico border wallWhile answering questions in the first Vice-President debate with Democrat candidate Tim Walz, Vance accused Kamala Harris of allowing fentanyl to flow into the US through the southern border and added that the Trump administration would target "migrants with criminal histories" if elected to power.

Babar Azam resigns as Pakistan's ODI and T20I captain for second time in a yearStar batter Babar Azam stepped down as the captain of Pakistan's ODI and T20I team on Wednesday, October 2. Babar said he took the decision to manage his workload and focus more on contributing to the team with the bat. It is the second time in less than a year that Babar has stepped down as Pakistan captain.

BCCI makes sophisticated Athlete Monitoring System available to state associationsThe Indian cricket board extended the use of the sophisticated Athlete Management System to state associations. With the AMS, a cricketer's progress, including injury and rehabilitation, can be stored and tracked.

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.
